Day1_Baha_JV: ^Nothing much, as per usual. And sure thing.
^Captain Baha Blast.! It’s your favorite lead engineer.
^Ergo, your favorite. Got a minute to clear some pre-arrival checks?
^Copy. Our daily perimeter checks and gear assessments are all squeaky clean...
^But…the steering gear’s being a bit sticky.
^“Sticky”, is that the technical term for it?
^Oh absolutely. I need your “official permission” to cycle them through a cleaning and that oughta do the trick.
^Don’t touch the helm for the next hour or we’ll all explode and die.
^Wow, Baha Blast. what’re you gonna do with all this free time? Got any sappy prose you need my highly attuned literary opinion on?
^Come on C.B., share your art with me!
^Maybe another time. Too many philistines on the bridge.
^Careful, Baha. You’re starting to sound like Ducksly.
^I gotta go. Steering will be back within the hour, everything’s fine!
Day1_Baha_Ducksly: ^Mhm. What can I do for you Ducksly?
^Captain, we’ve been over this. When someone greets you with Quackcelsior you’re supposed to-
^I was looking over the pre-arrival check-list you sent out and I noticed there was an item for medical check-ups on the crew.
^Well, it's just that the equipment that I would need is currently in use.
^Well, as our science officer, since our mission departure I thought I would be fruitful to conduct a bit of research.
^That’s nice and all, but we’re about to arrive. I’m sure you can spare some equipment from your “non-regulated research”.

^But, Captain! We’ve been traveling faster than light for the better part of a galactic year on our way to the Edge! How many species get to experience life at such speed? What does that do to a species' physiology?
^That’s fascinating Ducksly, it truly is. But -
^Exactly, Captain! I could be the first to know what happens to life at this scale. If I were to redistribute the equipment at this juncture, it would -
^Ducksly, please just get the medical checks done.
^Again, Captain, think of how our bodies all might’ve changed just over these few months.
^Ducksly! That’s not our mission. I’m sorry to say but your research is going to have to be put on pause.
^Captain, please I must ask you to reconsider! This is important to me, just as much as our mission is.
^How many times do I need to say this: but it’s not just about you. I need those check ups done. Alright?
^If J.V asked for some equipment for some smooth-brained project, you wouldn’t hesitate to grant her leniency!
^How about you let Officer Veldspar worry about her portion of the check-list and you worry about yours, Officer Ducksly. Get those checks done.
^The crew doesn’t just need these check ups. I need them. Ok?
Day1_Dover_Baha: ^Lt Dover "Guess I'll see how the Captain is doing.
^Cpt Baha "Dover. Thanks for picking up. I hope I'm not taking you away from your responsibilities.
^Lt Dover "No need to apologize Captain! Not much going on over here.
^Cpt Baha "Of course...You know how it is. Everyone's getting their Pre-arrival checks in.
^Lt Dover "Oh for sure, I can hear people running around.
^Lt Dover "Of course, because you can hear everything through the coms.

s: ^Oh No I can just hear them outside my door...
^That's right. I hear everything from my lair!

g-0: ^Cpt Baha "I'm sure you already know I talked to Ducksly not to long ago.
^Lt Dover "Yeah! How'd that go? they mentioned urgent business.
^Lt Dover "Hard to tell if something is acutally serious with that one sometimes.
^Cpt Baha "Apparently he's got too many experiments going on to actually start on his checklist.
^Lt Dover "Oh yeah they've been studying our bodies or something right?
^Cpt Baha "Either way... I shouldn't have to ask my science officer to do his job.

s: ^Wait. Don't their experiments kinda count as health check ups?
^Well, this is your ship Captain. You word is law.

Wait: ^Lt Dover "Well, like I said, they've been studying the conditions of our bodies.
^Lt Dover "And that means if something was wrong with one of our bodies they would've already notified you.
^Lt Dover "So doesn't that imply that you're checking up on the patients health condition as well?
^Lt Dover "Did you guys not realize that? That you were both on the same page?
^Cpt Baha "I guess you're right. But then there's the other problem.
Well: ^Cpt Baha "You're right. You know I don't like to be the bad guy. But we need to maintain order.
OtherProblem: ^Cpt Baha "Regardless of what I said before, Ducksly has displayed zero care for the ship or anyone on this crew.
^Lt Dover " Oh what! They're nice to me?
^Cpt Baha "Hmm. I just don't know what to do with him.
^Cpt Baha "I've served with a lot of hard heads over my career, but Ducksly...
^Cpt Baha "And he also has this weird rivalry with Officer Veldspar?

s: ^Maybe you should take interest in his Work? Might open him up a bit mroe?
^Inviting to our crew happy hours might be worth something.

Consider: ^Cpt Baha "Something to defintitely consider. Thank you Dover.

Day1_Dover_Ducksly: ^FOR TESTING PURPOSES: This choice is rerouting to the Day1_Dover_Ducksly knot to test variables.

^PLEASE DON'T TYPE IN THIS AREA AND ONLY USE THE MOUSE TO CLICK CHOICES ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE SCREEN.
Day1_Start: ^JV "Heeeeeey Dover, what's up? Can you patch me in to Baha? He's probably on the Bridge.
^Ducksly "Bonjour Dover, might you be so kind as to connect me with Captain Baha? Urgent business. Statistically, he's on the Bridge at this hour.
